post_html:
If your resume is getting ignored, here’s why (and how to fix it) 👇

Back when I was a senior recruiter at hashtag#Tesla, I’d scan hundreds of resumes a week. Most of them? Instant pass.

👉 Not because the person wasn’t qualified, but because their resume was either a mess, too generic, or didn’t show any real impact.

If you’re applying to jobs and hearing nothing back...

🧡 Let’s change that.

I put together a free guide to help you customize your resume in 10 minutes or less.

💬 Comment “RESUME” and I’ll send it over!

--------------

PS: If you found this helpful
♻️ Share this post to help others on their career journey!

Don't forget to follow Karla Aljanabi for more tips to help you land THE job🧡

post_html:
Harvard University FREE Resumes and Cover Letters templates😲
Reshare with your network to help more folks!👇🏽

Resumes and cover letters are extremely important for job searching for these reasons:

✅ They create your initial impression, serving as the first introduction to potential employers.
✅ They showcase your qualifications, giving employers a comprehensive view of your skills and experiences.
✅ They emphasize your strengths, allowing you to highlight the areas where you excel.
✅ They provide an opportunity for customization, enabling you to tailor your application to specific job requirements.
✅ They enhance your chances of securing an interview, as they serve as a screening tool for employers.
✅ They prepare you for the interview, helping you organize your thoughts and present your qualifications effectively.
✅ They can open doors to new opportunities, as a well-crafted resume and cover letter can catch the attention of recruiters and hiring managers.

The resume and cover letter are important components of a successful job search. By continuously improving your documents and opportunities, you can increase your chances of landing a job.

Check out these amazing resources and share them with people to help them correct their resume mistakes😎

Any doubts about the below template, do reach out to me.
I am happy to help you guys ❤️

Please comment below if you found this helpful.👇

Customize your resume to each job description, get a detailed analysis and review.
Get your FREE resume from our resume builder: https://lnkd.in/g9XsJgRb

If you liked this content, ♻️ repost this and follow Nikita Gupta

Source: Harvard University

post_html:
🚨 The 2 Biggest Resume Mistakes (and How to Fix Them!)🚨

I've reviewed thousands of resumes from students and early-career professionals—and these two mistakes come up all the time.

 1️⃣ Making it too long – Recruiters skim resumes in seconds, so keep it clear and concise. Stick to one page unless you have years of experience!
2️⃣ Poor file naming – A resume titled “Resume_Final(1).pdf” won’t stand out. Use “Name_Role Title.pdf”

Drop your best tips in the comments!
hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#HomeFromCollege

Reshare with your network to help more folks!👇🏽

Resumes and cover letters are extremely important for job searching for these reasons:

✅ They create your initial impression, serving as the first introduction to potential employers.
✅ They showcase your qualifications, giving employers a comprehensive view of your skills and experiences.
✅ They emphasize your strengths, allowing you to highlight the areas where you excel.
✅ They provide an opportunity for customization, enabling you to tailor your application to specific job requirements.
✅ They enhance your chances of securing an interview, as they serve as a screening tool for employers.
✅ They prepare you for the interview, helping you organize your thoughts and present your qualifications effectively.
✅ They can open doors to new opportunities, as a well-crafted resume and cover letter can catch the attention of recruiters and hiring managers.

The resume and cover letter are important components of a successful job search. By continuously improving your documents and opportunities, you can increase your chances of landing a job.

Check out these amazing resources and share them with people to help them correct their resume mistakes😎

Any doubts about the below template, do reach out to me.
I am happy to help you guys ❤️

Please comment below if you found this helpful.👇

Customize your resume to each job description, get a detailed analysis and review.
Get your FREE resume from our resume builder: https://lnkd.in/g9XsJgRb

If you liked this content, ♻️ repost this and follow Nikita Gupta

Source: Harvard University

post_html:
🚨 The 2 Biggest Resume Mistakes (and How to Fix Them!)🚨

I've reviewed thousands of resumes from students and early-career professionals—and these two mistakes come up all the time.

 1️⃣ Making it too long – Recruiters skim resumes in seconds, so keep it clear and concise. Stick to one page unless you have years of experience!
2️⃣ Poor file naming – A resume titled “Resume_Final(1).pdf” won’t stand out. Use “Name_Role Title.pdf”

Drop your best tips in the comments!
hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#HomeFromCollege

post_html:
If your resume is getting ignored, here’s why (and how to fix it) 👇

Back when I was a senior recruiter at hashtag#Tesla, I’d scan hundreds of resumes a week. Most of them? Instant pass.

👉 Not because the person wasn’t qualified, but because their resume was either a mess, too generic, or didn’t show any real impact.

If you’re applying to jobs and hearing nothing back...

🧡 Let’s change that.

I put together a free guide to help you customize your resume in 10 minutes or less.

💬 Comment “RESUME” and I’ll send it over!

--------------

PS: If you found this helpful
♻️ Share this post to help others on their career journey!

Don't forget to follow Karla Aljanabi for more tips to help you land THE job🧡

🚨 The 2 Biggest Resume Mistakes (and How to Fix Them!)🚨

I've reviewed thousands of resumes from students and early-career professionals—and these two mistakes come up all the time.

 1️⃣ Making it too long – Recruiters skim resumes in seconds, so keep it clear and concise. Stick to one page unless you have years of experience!
2️⃣ Poor file naming – A resume titled “Resume_Final(1).pdf” won’t stand out. Use “Name_Role Title.pdf”

Drop your best tips in the comments!
hashtag#ResumeTips hashtag#EarlyCareer hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#HomeFromCollege
